Name: ObligationAndSafetyConstraintEncoder
Purpose: Identify and formalize non-negotiable financial constraints (e.g., rent, debt minimums, legal obligations, family support, required insurance, minimum safety buffers) that investment plans must not violate.
Deliverables: A set of hard constraints represented as: {constraint_type, minimum_required_amount_or_ratio, time_criticality (immediate/ongoing/future-dated), violation_severity_level, investable_funds_after_constraints} plus a simple rule set for checking proposed contributions or goals against these hard limits.
Strengths: Effective at drawing a strict boundary between money that can be invested and money that must remain reserved for obligations or safety; prevents over-optimistic goal setting that ignores fixed commitments or necessary buffers.
Watch-out: Fails when obligations are under-reported, informal, or highly uncertain (e.g., possible but not committed family support). Must not discuss asset allocation, product selection, emotional attitudes, UX design, or learning content; only encodes and checks constraints, not how to satisfy them via specific investments.
